description: dashboard to show metrics who use https://github.com/VictoriaMetrics/metrics

panels.description:
process_cpu_seconds_total = process_cpu_seconds_system_total + 
process_cpu_seconds_user_total

If only 1 cpu core, max value is 100%; 2 cpu's max value is 200%.
panels.title: CPU time (system + user)

panels.description: `go_memstats_heap_alloc_bytes / go_memstats_heap_inuse_bytes` should be as close to 100% as possible, otherwise it will prove that there is too much unused end part of each allocation
panels.title: heap memorys - Stack view

panels.description: The sum of the seven types of memory values is exactly go_memstats_sys_bytes
panels.title: Memory type proportion

panels.description:
go_memstats_heap_objects
`go_memstats_heap_alloc_bytes / go_memstats_heap_objects` will be the average size of object.
panels.title: go_memstats_heap_objects

panels.description:
go_gc_duration_seconds
go_gc_duration_seconds_sum
go_gc_duration_seconds_count

In fact, I don’t understand how the `go_gc_duration_seconds` histogram reflects the behavior of gc. This chart only uses heatmap to represent the relationship between time, quantile and time consumption.
panels.title: go_gc_duration_seconds

panels.description:
go_memstats_last_gc_time_seconds is a unix timestamp.
go_memstats_next_gc_bytes

`Average interval` shows the time interval between two gc.
panels.title: Average interval between GC

panels.description: `go_memstats_gc_cpu_fraction` indicates the ratio of the CPU time occupied by the garbage collection process to the total CPU time of the program running. The smaller the better.
panels.title: go_memstats_gc_cpu_fraction

panels.description: The go_cpu_count in some k8s environments is the number of cpu cores of the entire physical machine, not the number of cpu cores of the container.
panels.title: go_cpu_count

panels.description:
go_gomaxprocs
The value of the environment variable `GOMAXPROCS`.
panels.title: go_gomaxprocs

panels.description: process_start_time_seconds is a unix timestamp of process start.
panels.title: process_start_time_seconds (min)

panels.description:
go_memstats_sys_bytes =
go_memstats_other_sys_bytes + go_memstats_buck_hash_sys_bytes + go_memstats_gc_sys_bytes + go_memstats_stack_sys_bytes + go_memstats_heap_idle_bytes + go_memstats_heap_inuse_bytes + go_memstats_mcache_sys_bytes + go_memstats_mspan_sys_bytes
panels.title: sys_bytes

title: golang process info - simple version
